title: 109_hr3672
content: The Act titled "TANF Emergency Response and Recovery Act of 2005" allows for the advance payment of TANF block grants for the first quarter of fiscal year 2006. The TANF Emergency Response and Recovery Act of 2005 authorizes the advance payment of TANF block grants for the first quarter of fiscal year 2006, extending activities through December 31, 2005. The Social Security Act is amended to extend certain provisions through December 31, 2005, including the National Random Sample Study of Child Welfare and Child Welfare Waiver Authority. Grants and payments can be made under this authority until the end of the year. Payments can be made under this authority through the first quarter of fiscal year 2006 at the same level as the first quarter of fiscal year 2005. Reimbursement of states for TANF benefits provided to assist families affected by Hurricane Katrina. Beginning with the enactment of this Act until August 31, 2006, a State qualifies as needy if it provides short-term, nonrecurring cash benefits to families affected by Hurricane Katrina who have relocated from a disaster-declared area. The State must confirm that the family is not receiving benefits from any other State program funded under the same part. The State receiving funds under section 403(b)(3)(A) for needy families affected by Hurricane Katrina must ensure that the total cash benefits do not exceed the amount provided to the families. No State match is required for payments made under this section. SEC. 4. AVAILABILITY OF ADDITIONAL TANF FUNDS FOR HURRICANE-DAMAGED STATES. Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama eligible for loans under the Social Security Act for fiscal year 2006. Loans forgiven for failure to repay or make interest payments. SEC. 5 allows States or tribes to use unspent TANF funds to support needy families affected by Hurricane Katrina without fiscal year limitation. SEC. 6 states that work requirements and time limits under the TANF program are not triggered by temporary benefits received by families affected by the hurricane. SEC. 7 waives TANF penalties in hurricane-damaged states. SEC. 7 waives TANF penalties in hurricane-damaged states, specifically Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama, due to Hurricane Katrina or state actions to aid victims.
